text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Miyake was born in Sapporo on October 13, 1995. After playing JFA Academy Fukushima, she joined INAC Kobe Leonessa in 2013. In 2011, Miyake was part of the Japan U-16 team that won the 2011 AFC U-16 Championship. In 2012, she represented the Japan U-17 team at the 2012 U-17 World Cup. On September 11, 2013, she received her first the senior team call-up. On September 22, she made her debut in a 2–0 win over Nigeria. In 2018, she played at 2018 Asian Cup and Japan won the championship. In 2019, she was selected Japan for 2019 World Cup. ==Statistics== List of match in 2013, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2013 1 0 2014 0 0 2015 0 0 2016 0 0 2017 5 0 2018 11 0 2019 4 0 2020 3 0 Total 24 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * *Japan Football Association Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Hokkaidō Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:INAC Kobe Leonessa players Category:2019 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:2018 AFC Women's Asian Cup players Category:Footballers at the 2018 Asian Games Category:AFC Women's Asian Cup- winning players Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games gold medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 2018 Asian Games
title: Shiori Miyake
